com.orbitz.monitoring.api.template
Class TransactionMonitorTemplate

java.lang.Object
  com.orbitz.monitoring.api.template.TransactionMonitorTemplate

public class TransactionMonitorTemplate
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates the logic involed in properly handling a TransactionMonitor. It also avoids breaking that logic by eliminating the cancer pattern of the logic itself.

A new TransactionMonitor will be built using the given Class and Monitor name, handed to the callback for use.

Method Detail

doInMonitor

public java.lang.Object doInMonitor(java.lang.String monitorName,
                                    TransactionMonitorCallback callback)
Builds a TransactionMonitor with just a monitor name and exeuctes the given callback within the monitored try/catch/finally block.

Parameters:
monitorName - MonitorName used to construct a TransactionMonitor
callback - TransactionMonitorCallback to execute
Returns:
anything the callback returns

doInMonitor

public java.lang.Object doInMonitor(java.lang.Class cls,
                                    java.lang.String monitorName,
                                    TransactionMonitorCallback callback)
Builds a TransactionMonitor with a class name and monitor name; and exeuctes the given callback within the monitored try/catch/finally block.

Parameters:
cls - class to use when constructing the TransactionMonitor
monitorName - MonitorName used to construct a TransactionMonitor
callback - TransactionMonitorCallback to execute
Returns:
anything the callback returns

createMonitor

protected TransactionMonitor createMonitor(java.lang.Class cls,
                                           java.lang.String monitorName)
Hook method for overriding how the template creates TransactionMonitors

Parameters:
cls - class to use (may be null)
monitorName - should not be null
Returns:
TransactionMonitor to use

executeCallback

protected java.lang.Object executeCallback(TransactionMonitorCallback callback,
                                           TransactionMonitor monitor)
Override this method to override how the Template executes the callback. You probably shouldn't need to override this; but who am I to judge?

Parameters:
callback - TransactionMonitorCallback to execute
monitor - TransactionMonitor to use
Returns:
anything the callback returns
